definitions: A measure of the relative quality of statistical models for a given set of data.
A criterion used for model selection among a finite set of models; it estimates the relative amount of information lost by a given model.
examples: The Akaike information criterion was used to compare the different regression models.
Lower values of the Akaike information criterion generally indicate a better fit.
Researchers often consider the Akaike information criterion when selecting the most parsimonious model.
